page.title: 15Historic Trades
page.content: During the Middle Ages, Wolvey was a thriving town of{KNITTERS}and millers with about 27{WINDMILLS.}The high position of Wolvey made it accessible to cooling winds to drive the mills. Only 4 windmills existed in the early 1800's and the last to remain was sold and pulled down in 1909. The demand for white flour was the death knell of the mills for they could only produce wholemeal. During the 1800's stocking-making was the main{INDUSTRY}of the villagers and for a time the stockingers were able to hold their own against the new machinery by taking wage-cuts. Eventually the machines won and those villagers who could not find work left the village for the town. The{POPULATION} in 1851 was 963, reducing to 693 in 1901 and in 1921 it was 686.
